item.title: Hitting through prayer and bank help
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Add an } at the end of the command

} else if (cmd[0].equals("bank")) { if(p.attackPlayer > 0) { p.frames.sendMessage(p, "You can't do that during combat!"); } else { p.openBank(); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Hitting through prayer and bank help
item.dc:creator: @luster_xg luster xg
item.description:
@luster_xg wrote:

[quote=“Infinity Zr, post:6, topic:311748”][quote author=Infinity Zr link=topic=408152.msg3013606#msg3013606 date=1257026782]
you mean agressive npcs?

If so open up

NPChandler class And serch

public boolean npcGetsAnnoyed(int Npc) {

Under it you should see lots of Case`s

so it would be

case npcid:

so it would look like this

case 1776:

There you go veacs will now hit strong

Also you should see this

[quote]public boolean npcGetsAnnoyed(int Npc) {
switch(npcs[Npc].npcType) {
case 50:
case 3200:
case 1115:
case 1459:
case 1155:
case 1160:
case 2627:
case 2881:
case 2882:
case 2883:
case 2630:
case 2697:
case 2631:
case 2738:
case 2741:
case 2743:[/quote]

[/quote]

Yh so the npc to hit harder follow what i said[/quote]
-.- i dont want it to hit harder. i want it to hit THROUGH PRAYER.

Read full topic

hmm for the bank thing try making a case like this:

case 22332: if InCombat == true && command.EqualsIgnoreCase("bank") { command.EqualsIgnoreCase("bank") == false; sM("you can't bank in combat"); Break;
try something like that i just made it from scratch

public boolean npcGetsAnnoyed(int Npc) { switch(npcs[Npc].npcType) { case 50: case 3200: case 1115: case 1459: case 1155: case 1160: case 2627: case 2881: case 2882: case 2883: case 2630: case 2697: case 2631: case 2738: case 2741: case 2743:
